xxl.connectivity.jama
Class KoenigWeikumQFSEstimator.PartitioningStrategy

java.lang.Object
  xxl.connectivity.jama.KoenigWeikumQFSEstimator.PartitioningStrategy
Enclosing class:
KoenigWeikumQFSEstimator
protected abstract class KoenigWeikumQFSEstimator.PartitioningStrategy
extends Object

This class provides a skeleton implementation for the partitioning strategies used in [KW99] to partition (the phase of preprocessing of the algorithm) the data the histogram is based upon.

Constructor Summary
protected KoenigWeikumQFSEstimator.PartitioningStrategy()
           
 
Method Summary

          This method fills the buckets with the boundaries.
protected  double[] getBucket(int pos)
          Returns a bucket represented by a double [] of length 8.
protected  double getCor(double[] b)
          Returns the correlation between values and frequencies in the specified bucket.
protected  double getCov(double[] b)
          Returns the covariance of the bucket.
protected  double getErr(double[] b)
          Returns the least square error of the bucket when the average of frequencies is used as approximation.
protected  double getError(double[] b)
          Returns the least square error of the bucket when a linear spline is used as approximation.
protected  double getFreqSD(double[] b)
          Returns the standard deviation of the frequencies in the specified bucket.
protected  double getIntersection(double[] b)
          Returns the point of intersection with the y-axis of the linear spline which is used as approximation.

          Returns the slope of the linear spline which is used as approximation.

          Returns the standard deviation of the values in the specified bucket.

          This method merges the first delivered bucket with the second one by adding the values.

Constructor Detail

KoenigWeikumQFSEstimator.PartitioningStrategy

protected KoenigWeikumQFSEstimator.PartitioningStrategy()
Method Detail

getBucket

protected double[] getBucket(int pos)
Returns a bucket represented by a double [] of length 8. Each statistical and descriptive value of each bucket will be internally stored in a double [] for reasons of reducing needed memory, so a mapping back to each bucket is needed.

Parameters:
pos - number of bucket to return
Returns:
a bucket represented by a double [] of length 8

merge

protected void merge(double[] left,
                     double[] right)
This method merges the first delivered bucket with the second one by adding the values. Its presupposed that "left" is the left neighbour of "right".

Parameters:
left - left bucket
right - right bucket

fill

protected abstract void fill(int[] boundaries)
This method fills the buckets with the boundaries.

Parameters:
boundaries - boundaries to fill in
